stance_1: I choose chicken, turkey, or fish over beef
stance_2: I limit red meat to once a week
justification: Limiting red meat and choosing chicken, turkey, or fish over beef are directly linked as alternative choices for health reasons.

stance_1: I choose chicken, turkey, or fish over beef
justification: Choosing poultry or fish over beef is explicitly motivated by trying to eat healthier.

stance_1: I cook most meals at home
stance_2: I limit red meat to once a week
justification: Cooking at home allows the interviewee to control meal content and thus limit red meat intake.

stance_1: I cook most meals at home
stance_2: I choose chicken, turkey, or fish over beef

stance_1: I cook most meals at home
stance_2: My husband tries to eat 100 grams of protein daily
justification: Cooking at home allows the interviewee to plan meals that help her husband reach his protein target.

stance_2: I want to get enough protein
justification: Eating meat regularly is explicitly motivated by the desire to meet protein intake goals.

stance_2: My husband tries to eat 100 grams of protein daily
justification: Both the interviewee and her husband eat meat regularly to achieve protein intake goals.
The interviewee balances regular meat consumption with health-motivated choices, such as limiting red meat.

stance_2: I limit red meat to once a week
justification: Limiting red meat is explicitly done to support a healthier diet.

stance_2: I want to get enough protein
justification: The interviewee balances health goals with the need to consume enough protein, combining both motivations in meal planning.

stance_1: I want to get enough protein
stance_2: My husband tries to eat 100 grams of protein daily

stance_1: I want to get enough protein
stance_2: I limit red meat to once a week

stance_2: I limit red meat to once a week
justification: Limiting red meat partially conflicts with eating meat regularly; the interviewee eats meat but restricts certain types.

stance_1: I cook most meals at home

justification: The interviewee controls her home meals and limits red meat, unlike her extended family who eats more red meat and less home-cooked food.

stance_1: I limit red meat to once a week

stance_1: I cook most meals at home
